> 9 hours ago, JcoolTheShipbuilder said:

> What’s the community rep system for?
> 

That’s a good question.   There is no real purpose to it.   We don’t give out prizes or recognition for a certain number of likes.   But people do like to have others appreciate their work or ideas, and this is just a simple way of letting others know they are appreciated.     

It also serves to cut way back on the spammy “+1”, “^”, and “This” posts.

Because we would know what happen if they made the moderator title in red...

For perspective, remember the original Star Trek series:

- Gold was command
- Blue was science
- Red were security/engineering  and therefore, expendable. There were a lot of "red shirts" that beamed down but never beamed back up.

> Are you all privy to any secret KSP insider info? ![:ph34r:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ph34r.png ":ph34r:")

Nope.  We're not Squad employees, we're just volunteers who help out with the forum, so we don't have any more visibility into what's going on inside KSP production than you do.

We do occasionally get a *<u>little</u>* bit of advance warning when a major announcement happens in the forums (so we can plan accordingly, make sure that some of us are around when the news breaks, that sort of thing)-- in which case we'll sometimes learn stuff a few hours *<u>before</u>* you do.  But we don't learn any *<u>more</u>* than you do, generally speaking.
